description: The US has softened its earlier resistance to a broader Israeli military operation in Rafah following efforts by Israel to reduce the civilian toll of the assault, a US official said.
title: US Encouraged by Israeli Changes to Plans for Rafah Operation

description: Fidelity Investments Chief Executive Officer Abby Johnson is among invitees to a fundraiser for President Joe Biden in Boston on Tuesday, according to people familiar with the matter.
title: Fidelity’s Abby Johnson Raises Cash for Biden at Boston Event

description: Crowds of desperate people in the Gaza Strip have intercepted almost all of the aid sent over a temporary pier built by the US military, officials said, forcing a temporary halt to deliveries and complicating an already dire humanitarian crisis.
title: Crowds Intercept Almost All Aid Sent Over US-Built Pier in Gaza

description: Unlike his reform-era predecessors, Xi Jinping can’t count on rapid gains in prosperity to underpin support for Communist Party rule.
title: End of China's Boom Years Risks Political Peril for Xi

description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Today, congressional correspondent Christian Hall looks at how Congress is coming to the aid of Michael Andretti in a fight fight to field a Formula 1 team. Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.
title: Congress Jumps in to Back Andretti Family in Fight With F1

description: With the death of Iranian President Ebrahim Raisi in a helicopter crash May 19, the country is scheduled to elect a new head of government in voting June 28. Raisi’s death has perhaps greater consequences for the future of a more important post, in that he was expected to succeed Ayatollah Ali Khamenei, 84, Iran’s supreme leader, one of the most powerful positions in the Middle East.
title: How Iran President’s Death Shakes Up Betting on Next Supreme Leader

description: A man charged in a UK espionage case for assisting a foreign intelligence service from Hong Kong has died for “unexplained” reasons, British police said.
title: Suspect in Hong Kong-Linked Espionage Case Dies, UK Police Say

description: President Joe Biden’s administration is pressing negotiators to reach agreements on new contracts for flight attendants and airline caterers, hoping to give a boost to union allies without setting off a summer of labor strife that could have dire consequences for his reelection hopes.
title: American Air, Gate Gourmet Face Pressure on Contracts to Avoid Strikes

description: At least 85 people were reported dead at a hospital in the capital of Sudan’s North Darfur state, an early indication of the human toll from fighting between the army and an opposition militia around the last major city in the region still held by the government.
title: Hospital Reports 85 Dead in New Fighting in Sudan’s North Darfur

description: The far-right party of Marine Le Pen, which is on course to trounce French President Emmanuel Macron’s group in this year’s European elections, said it will end cooperation with Alternative for Germany in the next European Parliament following Nazi-related statements.
title: Le Pen’s Party Cuts Ties With German AfD Over Nazi Comments

description: Oil industry titans are opening their checkbooks to support Donald Trump, with Texas tycoons Syed Javaid Anwar and Jeff Hildebrand among the donors contributing to the Republican candidate’s biggest fundraising month yet.
title: Oil Titans Help Give Trump an Edge Over Biden in Fundraising

description: Klaus Schwab, the founder and executive chairman of the World Economic Forum, is stepping down from active leadership of the body that convenes the annual meetings of global executives and politicians in Davos, Switzerland.
title: World Economic Forum Founder Klaus Schwab Is Stepping Down, Semafor Reports

description: The White House denounced Republican Donald Trump after a video was posted to his social media account that referenced a “unified reich” as a potential news headline if he won a second term, calling it “dangerous and offensive.”
title: Trump’s ‘Unified Reich’ Post Is ‘Sickening,’ White House Says

description: Russia started combat drills to practice the use of tactical nuclear weapons, a show of force to the US and its allies over President Vladimir Putin’s war in Ukraine.
title: Russia Begins Planned Tactical Nuclear Drills in Show of Force

description: Over the years, David Magerman has given $10 million to the University of Pennsylvania. When it came time for his sons to go to college, they chose Penn, just like their father. In an acknowledgment of his support, a wing in the school’s nanotechnology hub was named for him.
title: ‘I Don’t Want to Save Penn’: Alumni Break Over University’s Future

description: A bipartisan group of senators led by Amy Klobuchar urged the Justice Department to investigate whether Formula 1 is violating US antitrust laws for rejecting a bid by Michael Andretti to join the multibillion-dollar motor racing series.
title: Senators Seek Antitrust Probe of F1 Over Rejecting Michael Andretti Team

description: Donald Trump once vowed to take the witness stand in his hush money criminal trial in Manhattan, but his defense case wrapped up Tuesday morning without jurors hearing from the former president.
title: Trump Ends Defense in Hush Money Trial Without Testifying

description: US Secretary of State Antony Blinken called the decision by International Criminal Court’s chief prosecutor to seek arrest warrants for Israeli leaders on charges of war crimes in Gaza as “extremely wrongheaded,” echoing criticism leveled by President Joe Biden.
title: Blinken Says ICC Israeli Arrest Warrants ‘Extremely Wrongheaded’

description: Joe Biden came into office thinking the Middle East wouldn’t be a top priority, but turmoil there has now become a central issue for his presidency and one that threatens his chances of reelection.
title: Biden Hurt Abroad and at Home By More Middle East Tension

description: South Africa’s Department of Home Affairs refiled long-awaited changes to its work-permit regime to allow for the creation of a so-called nomad visa for remote workers.
title: South Africa Refiles Work-Permit Changes to Create Nomad Visa

description: Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen said the US push to tap frozen Russian assets for Ukraine’s benefit isn’t driven by the looming presidential election in November, but by Kyiv’s needs.
title: Yellen Says Ukraine Need, Not US Election, Driving Aid Talks

description: A Russian general who said he was dismissed after criticizing the scale of troop losses in Ukraine has been detained on fraud allegations.
title: Russia Detains ‘Spartacus’ General Who Criticized Troop Losses

description: After a series of recent setbacks, Europe’s far-right parties are aiming for big gains in elections to the European Parliament on June 6-9. A significant rightward tilt would thrust migration to the top of Europe’s political agenda in the coming years, and complicate progress on the bloc’s ambitious climate agenda. It would also serve as a warning signal to national governments by highlighting sinking support for leaders including France’s Emmanuel Macron and Germany’s Olaf Scholz.
title: What a Far Right Surge in European Elections Would Mean for the EU

description: To his supporters, Wikileaks co-founder Julian Assange is a martyr who’s been persecuted for exposing corruption and war crimes. To others, he’s an unscrupulous hacker who put lives in danger by publishing sensitive state secrets.
title: Why Julian Assange Extradition Fight Has Lasted Years

description: French President Emmanuel Macron plans to visit New Caledonia after a week of unrest over proposed changes to election voting rules rocked the overseas territory.
title: France’s Macron to Visit New Caledonia After Week of Unrest

description: Lawmakers in Slovakia unanimously backed a parliamentary resolution condemning the shooting of Prime Minister Robert Fico, an effort to dial back political recriminations in the country after the May 15 assassination attempt.
title: Slovak Lawmakers Unite Behind Condemnation of Premier’s Shooting

description: Ukraine’s President Volodymyr Zelenskiy discussed the possibility of Germany providing his nation with additional air-defense systems during a visit by the German Foreign Minister Annalena Baerbock to Kyiv.
title: Zelenskiy Discussed Air Defenses With German Foreign Minister

description: The number of politically motivated crimes in Germany rose to the highest level in almost a quarter of a century last year, driven by a surge in right-wing extremism and Antisemitism.
title: German Politically Motivated Crime Surges to Highest on Record

description: Sweden’s defense minister said it will take as long as two years to reach desired capacity to furnish Ukraine with more ammunition and beef up its own military, after the Nordic nation became NATO’s newest member.
title: Swedish Defense Minister Says Arms Output Ramp-Up to Take Time

description: Canada’s annual rate of core inflation eased for a fourth straight month, bolstering a case for policymakers to begin an easing cycle in the coming months, but a slight increase in the monthly pace may keep a June rate cut from being a certainty.
title: Inflation in Canada Slows to 2.7%, Boosting June Rate Cut Odds

description: The US government condemned a raid by Kosovo police on a local Serbian bank, saying the operation wasn’t coordinated with Western allies and stokes already simmering tensions in the region.
title: US Decries Kosovo Police Raid on Serbian Bank

description: European Commission Vice President Vera Jourova said she plans to end the long-running conflict with Poland over rule-of-law concerns under the previous government by the end of May.
title: EU Seeks to End Rule-of-Law Spat With Poland by End of May

description: Rishi Sunak’s government set out plans to compensate victims of the UK’s decades-long infected blood scandal but without saying how much it will pay, after a public inquiry reported evidence of a cover-up by the British establishment the prime minister said “should shake our nation to its core.”
title: UK Sets Out Infected Blood Compensation Plan Without Total Sum

description: Higher weekly flows don’t prevent a drop in the less volatile four-week average
title: Russian Oil Flows Tick Higher as Moscow Pivots From Export Curbs

description: Spain has fully withdrawn its ambassador from Argentina, amid an escalating diplomatic rift between the two countries.
title: Spain to Fully Withdraw Ambassador From Argentina

description: Get caught up on the day’s political news
title: Infected Blood: Lessons From The Treatment Scandal

description: Democrats and Republicans squabble over leadership of the agency and the fate of tough new bank-capital rules.
title: FDIC Fight Exposes Grubby Politics of Regulation

description: Each day, Bloomberg journalists take you across a selection of towns and cities as they gear up for the big vote.
title: Modi Faces Challenge From Opposition Politician Out on Bail in Delhi Elections

description: Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan’s campaign to ensure sustainable economic growth by nurturing a larger and younger population faces a grave threat: a low birth rate.
title: Erdogan Alarmed by Falling Birth Rate Amid Push to Grow Economy

description: Welcome to Balance of Power, bringing you the latest in global politics. If you haven’t yet, sign up here.
title: Court Puts Netanyahu and Biden in a New Quandary

description: Manhattan prosecutors wrapped up their hush-money case against Donald Trump on Monday after more than four weeks of evidence that largely overcame initial doubts about the first criminal trial of a former US president, though the outcome of the case is anyone’s guess.
title: Trump Trial Shifts to Defense With Verdict Still Anyone’s Guess

description: European Union member states on Tuesday approved a plan to use the profits generated by frozen Russian sovereign assets to support Ukraine’s recovery and military defense.
title: EU Approves Plan to Use Profits From Frozen Russian Assets

description: Lithuania plans to raise taxes on companies and alcohol as part of package of measures the government is presenting to cover higher defense spending next year.
title: Lithuania to Raise Taxes to Cover Higher Defense Expenditures

description: A member of Thai Prime Minister Srettha Thavisin’s cabinet resigned on Tuesday, days before the nation’s charter court was due to consider a petition by a group of senators for the leader’s removal.
title: Thai Minister Quits Ahead of Court Decision on Plea to Oust PM

description: China slammed US Secretary of State Antony Blinken for extending his congratulations to Taiwan’s new president, underscoring how the island’s status divides the two superpowers.
title: China Condemns Blinken for Hailing New Taiwan President

description: Undecided voters are concerned that if Donald Trump returns to the White House, he’ll never leave.
title: A Hidden Variable in the Presidential Race: Fears of ‘Trump Forever’

description: ASML Holding NV and Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Co. have ways to disable the world’s most sophisticated chipmaking machines in the event that China invades Taiwan, according to people familiar with the matter.
title: ASML, TSMC Can Disable Chip Machines If China Invades Taiwan

description: Thailand is working on a supplementary budget that seeks to lift state spending by as much as 122 billion baht ($3.4 billion) as Prime Minister Srettha Thavisin presses ahead with a plan to stimulate the nation’s economy through a cash handout.
title: Thailand Mulls Up to $3.4 Billion Extra Budget to Finance Cash Handout Plan

description: Finland’s government introduced a draft law that allows it to stop migrants pushed by Russia to its eastern border in what the Nordic country says could be a basis for a European-level solution.
title: Finland Proposes Bill to Curb Weaponized Immigration by Russia

description: The Philippines is setting its sights on becoming the next manufacturing and logistics hub in Asia, President Ferdinand Marcos Jr. said, as Manila capitalizes on its growing ties with Washington.
title: Philippines Seeks Asia Logistics Hub Status, Banking on US Ties

description: Iran will hold presidential elections on June 28, the semi-official Tasnim news agency reported, following the death of Ebrahim Raisi in a helicopter crash over the weekend.
title: Iran to Hold Presidential Elections June 28 After Raisi’s Death

description: A flood of cheap metal and a global turn toward protectionism is testing the otherwise symbiotic relationship
title: China’s $8.5 Billion in Steel Spurs Latin America Toward Tariffs

description: The US Department of State has put Bangladesh’s former army chief Aziz Ahmed on a visa blacklist on allegations of bribery and improperly awarding military contracts for personal gain.
title: US Puts Former Bangladesh Army Chief on Visa Blacklist for Graft

description: Britons see just about the same risk of a Labour government raising their taxes as a Conservative one, according to a new poll, casting doubt on an oft-used Tory attack line ahead the UK election.
title: UK Voters See Tax Hikes Likely Whoever Wins Election, Poll Shows

description: Taiwan lawmakers are set to debate a bill that would expand their powers at the expense of the new president – and potentially spark large protests in the chip hub.
title: Taiwan’s Opposition Party Pushes Bill to Undermine New President

description: In an about face, German officials are ready to support a US plan to leverage the future revenue generated from frozen Russian assets — mostly stranded in Europe — to back $50 billion in aid to Ukraine, according to people familiar with the discussions.
title: Germany Warms to US Plan to Tap Frozen Russian Assets for Ukraine Funds

description: Donald Trump raised more money last month than Joe Biden for the first time in this election cycle, but the president’s campaign still holds a wide financial edge over his Republican rival.
title: Trump Leads Biden in Monthly Campaign Fundraising for First Time

description: President Joe Biden urged the Republican leaders of the House and Senate in calls on Monday to revive a bipartisan immigration measure that failed after Donald Trump proclaimed his opposition.
title: Biden Urges GOP Leaders to Revive Immigration Bill Opposed by Trump
